page.title: 06SPORT IN CATON & BROOKHOUSE
page.content: For a relatively small area Caton and Brookhouse boast a strong sporting tradition.Caton United Football Club, formed just after World War 1,plays in the N.Lancs League.The Club has won all the trophies open to it at various times.Caton+Brookhouse Juniors field 3 teams-Under12,U-14,U-16.The teams play on Sundays in the Rix Manor League and also compete in the Lancaster Sawmills Cup.Caton Cricket Club has its origins c1877 but was officially re-formed in 1947.League matches are on Saturdays, with Cup games on Sunday.The best recorded bowling figures are 10 wickets for 4 runs in 1930 by T.Nicholson. Lunesdale Lawn Tennis Club,formed 1905, based appropriately at Ball Lane,runs a league for juniors+an annual knockout for seniors.Brookhouse Badminton Club runs 3 teams.Crown Green Bowling is played at the Station Hotel.
